result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J Owens

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Prelim on November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Scheduling conference on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:35 AM - cases called - 22CF130 and 22CF147.  Defendant William J Owens not in court.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for William J Owens.  Attorney Andrew Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin - Defendant will be waiving the preliminary hearing.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  State requests a warrant.  Response by Atty Laufenberg.  Court issues warrant - body only - to be executed at 4:00 p.m. on September 12, 2022.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:49 AM - case called.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg appeared by video for William J Owens.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin - victim rights scheduling conference; no victim wishes to be heard.  Statement by the Court - off the record scheduling with Judicial Assistant.
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:01 AM - cases called - 22CF147 and 22CF130 (tracking).  Defendant William J Owens in court.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for William J Owens.  Attorney Andrew Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg - in receipt of complaint in 22CF147 - waive reading - waive time limits.  Bond has already been set.  Statement by the Court.
Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No contact with the Victim.  Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.  May not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol.

1:49 PM - case called.  Defendant William J Owens appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  In receipt of complaint - charges read to Defendant - right to counsel.  Statement by Defendant - will contact Atty Laufenberg.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
